intro: Neolaria ferresii, commonly known as the golden star coral, is a marine species belonging to the family Alcyoniidae. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow coloration and distinctive star-shaped polyps. This coral thrives in shallow, tropical waters, often forming dense colonies on reef substrates. Neolaria ferresii plays a crucial role in reef ecosystems by providing habitat and shelter for various marine organisms. Its growth pattern and color make it a visually striking component of coral reefs.
